originalText.text: I had such a bad experience. It is day 2 and my toes are already chipping. My powder French manicure was breaking and lifting off 1 day later. My nails were so long and they were roughly filed down even though I said the filing hurt. The corners of the squared nail was so sharp and she wouldn‚Äôt round them no matter how many times I asked. Then when I went back to get my nails fixed she was so rough and burned me with nail drill so many times. Truly my first and last time going. Plus it‚Äôs extremely out of the way. Not worth it.

originalText.text: 10/10 would recommend I walked in and was immediately greeted and seated I got there about 12:30 ish and left around 1:35 the lady (JANET) who did my nails was really patient with me and made sure I liked everything every step of the way . Her work is so clean ,neat and affordable I‚Äôm so happy to say I‚Äôve found my new nail tech üíï

originalText.text:
I‚Äôve been getting my nails done since the 8th grade, and they have NEVER looked this bad.

I‚Äôm giving this store 2 stars because there pedicures are okay. However,  the acrylic nails are HORRIBLE. I don‚Äôt mean to bash anyone but I asked for Coffin and left with duck tip nails which is unflattering to me.

originalText.text: I‚Äôll start by saying that I am a nail technician myself so I won‚Äôt bash any other upcoming technicians out there, but I WILL give my 100% honest critique. With 4th of July coming up, I‚Äôve been doing everyone‚Äôs nails but my own so decided to give this 4.2 stars salon a try! I can say at least the prices are reasonable‚Ä¶ even though for the work I got done it‚Äôs looking like a $30 set from envy nails back in 2010. The lady that did my nails was absolutely a sweet heart with my toddler and I, but most definitely needs more experience and training. I asked for a short petite squared acrylic set with gel Polish‚Ä¶ I left with nails that looked like ‚Äúduck nails‚Äù, streak marks on ALL ten fingers due to thick layers ofpolish being applied, uneven lengths, some nails were slanted, the acrylic application was way too thick for the length I asked for and her technique in ratio monomer to acrylic applying was way off. The cuticle bead wasn‚Äôt applied as close as it should‚Äôve been or could‚Äôve been, along with the Polish. I left with a fresh set that looked like I already needed a fill in & my nails were definitely bulky. All in all, the lady that did my nails was nice but needs more experience and practice for sure. As far as the rest of the staff they need more hospitality in their bones, I mean I didn‚Äôt get a greet until my 5 YEAR OLD and I said hi. I didn‚Äôt get asked what I wanted, I had to say it myself. When I left not one person said bye. No one‚Äôs saying ‚Äúkiss ass‚Äù but as someone who‚Äôs gone to other nail salons to review them & has worked in customer service, I can say the staff here isn‚Äôt as welcoming as I thought they‚Äôd be.

text.text: I‚Äôll start by saying that I am a nail technician myself so I won‚Äôt bash any other upcoming technicians out there, but I WILL give my 100% honest critique. With 4th of July coming up, I‚Äôve been doing everyone‚Äôs nails but my own so decided to give this 4.2 stars salon a try! I can say at least the prices are reasonable‚Ä¶ even though for the work I got done it‚Äôs looking like a $30 set from envy nails back in 2010. The lady that did my nails was absolutely a sweet heart with my toddler and I, but most definitely needs more experience and training. I asked for a short petite squared acrylic set with gel Polish‚Ä¶ I left with nails that looked like ‚Äúduck nails‚Äù, streak marks on ALL ten fingers due to thick layers ofpolish being applied, uneven lengths, some nails were slanted, the acrylic application was way too thick for the length I asked for and her technique in ratio monomer to acrylic applying was way off. The cuticle bead wasn‚Äôt applied as close as it should‚Äôve been or could‚Äôve been, along with the Polish. I left with a fresh set that looked like I already needed a fill in & my nails were definitely bulky. All in all, the lady that did my nails was nice but needs more experience and practice for sure. As far as the rest of the staff they need more hospitality in their bones, I mean I didn‚Äôt get a greet until my 5 YEAR OLD and I said hi. I didn‚Äôt get asked what I wanted, I had to say it myself. When I left not one person said bye. No one‚Äôs saying ‚Äúkiss ass‚Äù but as someone who‚Äôs gone to other nail salons to review them & has worked in customer service, I can say the staff here isn‚Äôt as welcoming as I thought they‚Äôd be.

originalText.text:
When my nail tech of three years went back to the Dominican republic I genuinely thought I would never find anyone as good again. I passed by Sofia‚Äòs and decided to stop in and I‚Äôm genuinely blown away !!

Digna puts so much care into your set‚Ä¶ not one chip or break for 3 weeks!! 10/10
